intro: Anthaenantiopsis perforata var. camporum, commonly known as the Camp's perforate antelope plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes. It is also noted for its adaptability to dry conditions and minimal water requirements.
